p: The number of nematode knots was 8.72-fold higher on average on A. sessilis roots than on A. philoxeroides roots. The knot number decreased with increasing soil collection latitude for both plant species, but the rate of decrease was more rapid for A. sessilis (slopes: −1.065 for A. sessilis vs. −0.336 for A. philoxeroides), which had higher numbers of knots at lower latitudes (Table 1 and Fig. 1b). The latitude effect size was larger for A. sessilis ( f 2 = 0.672) than for A. philoxeroides ( f 2 = 0.418).
